sentences.english: Suddenly someone struck up the International.
sentences.chinese: 突然間，有人開始唱國際歌。

sentences.english: His high notes quavered when he sang the “Internationale”.
sentences.chinese: 他唱《國際歌》時高音發顫。

sentences.english: The meeting ended up with the singing of The Internationale.
sentences.chinese: 會議最後以唱《國際歌》而結束。

sentences.english: The rally finished up with the singing of the Internationale.
sentences.chinese: 大會最後以高唱《國際歌》結束。

sentences.english: The meeting ended up with the International.
sentences.chinese: 會議最後以唱《國際歌》結束。

sentences.english: Play The Internationale on the piano.
A children's toy piano is playing the "The Internationale ".
sentences.chinese: 一架兒童玩具鋼琴自己彈奏《國際歌》。

sentences.english: The band struck up the Internationale.
The conference ended up with the singing of the Internationale.
sentences.chinese: 會議最後以高唱《國際歌》而結束。

sentences.english: They finished by singing the Internationale.

definition: March of the Volunteer Army (PRC National Anthem)
pinyin: Yi4 yong3 jun1 Jin4 xing2 qu3

definition: music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
pingshu, a folk art where a single performer narrates stories from history or fiction
to force someone to do something
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
